args: Imperial Territory\nThe Forest Near Hertz Village
They must be here somewhere!\nFind them, and show them the\nmight of the Empire!
Whew... We managed to drive them back.
But we've been hiding in this forest for\nfive days now. I'm starting to get sick\nof eating fruits and berries.
Stop complaining. Evading them would\nbe trivial, but if we do that...
They'll turn their anger on the people of\nHertz for defying them in the first place.
Yes. Eventually, they will realize their\ncontinued pursuit here is only wasting\nresources.

We need to hold out until then, and keep
drawing them into this forest in the
meantime. Now, prepare the next
round of traps.
What's got you so cheery? You didn't\neat anything strange, did you?
Heh. I just still can't believe you cast our\nmission aside to help those villagers.
Wait, do you smell something burning?
They're going to burn this whole forest\ndown with us in it!
This is bad... We're surrounded by flames!
We have to be able to break through\nsomewhere!
No dice—the flames are too strong!\n*cough* *cough*
Blast... Is this really the end?
Kirsty and Joachim, right? We've been\nsearching high and low for you.
Who are you? You don't look like\nimperial soldiers...
We can make introductions later.\nFor now, just know that we're\nhere to help!
We've secured an escape route.\nFollow us!
We don't have time to press them\non their identity.
We'll just have to trust them.\nWith me, Joachim!
You'll be safe here. There don't seem\nto be any imperials around.
Thank you both. We owe you our lives.
If anything, you owe those brothers\nback in Hertz. They asked us to help\nthe travelers who saved them.
That was kind of them indeed—but if the\nimperial army thinks we got away, that\nwhole village will be in danger.
Fret not! They have all retreated to\nthe Halidom's lands.
With the soldiers caught up searching for\nyou, we were able to lead the villagers\nto safety with ease.
The Halidom? Then you must be with the\nprince Noelle mentioned in her report.
Indeed we are. Now, we should make\na hasty retreat to the Halidom ourselves;\nthis is still imperial territory.
A party of this size would no doubt draw\nunwelcome attention. We're all wanted\nby the Empire at this point.
Wait! Before you leave, I have one\nquestion.
You are enemies of the Empire, yes?\nWhy did you take the risk of entering\ntheir territory?
The Halidom doesn't turn its back on\npeople in danger. That's just how we are!
What should we do now, Commander?
I think it's clear that an alliance with the\nEmpire would not be in our country's\nbest interests.

If their army's leaders are as wretched as
their soldiers, they would no doubt betray
us in time. We should return home to
report as much at once.
Agreed. A ＂breakdown in negotiations＂\nsounds about right.
Yes. And when we're inevitably sent\nback to open talks again, I intend to\nvisit the Halidom on the way.

The king may insist on allying with such
an openly evil power, but I won't stand
by and watch our home march itself
to ruin.
However, this journey has taught me that\nI still lack the knowledge necessary to fight\nfor what is just.
And if Victor is to be believed, the best\nplace to gain it may be at the Halidom.
Ah, hello Noelle. Are you here with new\norders from HQ?
It's all right. Just give me the message.

It's...an invitation. The sender claims to
be recruiting rebels to help cleanse our
nation of the corruption that has taken
root there.
A revolution, yes. Whoever wrote this says\nthey only sent these invitations to those\nwho ＂truly love our nation.＂
*nod* I-I gave one to Victor, too.
Mm, and how did he respond?
He... He pretended not to care. But I think\ndeep down, he really cares a lot!
Hmm. Well, either way, \nthe timing is suspicious.

Agreed. It's impossible to tell from this
letter alone whether the sender is a
well-intentioned patriot or simply
hungry for the king's power.
...But I have every intention of finding out.
